title: Israeli defense minister calls on Netanyahu to halt overhaul of courts
description: Israel’s defense minister, a senior ally of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, called for a freeze on the government’s attempt to remake the judicial system.

title: Ruling halts oil exports from Iraq's Kurdish area via Turkey
description: Iraqi officials announced Saturday that Baghdad has won an international arbitration case that will halt oil exports from the semi-autonomous Kurdish region by way of Turkey

title: Venezuela: 21 officials, businessmen arrested in oil scheme
description: Venezuela’s attorney general says 21 people, including senior officials in President Nicolás Maduro’s government and business leaders, have been arrested in connection with a corruption scheme involving international oil sales

title: Mexico sanctioned for not protecting endangered porpoise
description: Mexico faces sanctions from the international wildlife body known as CITES for not doing enough to protect the vaquita marina, a small porpoise that is the world’s most endangered marine mammal

title: Israeli defense minister calls for halt to judicial overhaul
description: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant is calling for an immediate and temporary halt to the far-right government’s contentious plan to overhaul the judiciary, the first public dissent from within Prime Minister Benjamin’s coalition

title: French activists wield axes, machetes at reservoir protest
description: French police and environmental campaigners have fought violent pitched battles around a giant agricultural irrigation reservoir in rural western France

title: Israel: 2 wounded in West Bank drive-by shooting
description: The Israeli military says two Israelis were wounded in a drive-by shooting in the occupied West Bank, the latest in months-long violence between Israel and the Palestinians

title: Mexican kid's comic Xavier López, 'Chabelo,' dies at 88
description: Xavier López, a Mexican children’s comic better known by his stage name, “Chabelo,” has died at 88

title: Brazil's Lula cancels trip to China because of pneumonia
description: Brazil’s presidential palace says that President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has canceled his trip to China after contracting pneumonia

title: Emil Bocek, last Czech RAF pilot during WWII, dies at 100
description: The last living Czech pilot who fought the Nazis while serving with Britain’s Royal Air Force during World War II has died at age 100

title: UN nuclear watchdog says missing Libya uranium found
description: The U.N.’s nuclear watchdog says U.N. inspectors visiting southern Libya found drums containing natural uranium reported missing earlier this month in the war-torn country

title: Jehovah's Witnesses mourn victims of Hamburg shooting
description: Members of the Jehovah’s Witnesses in Germany have held a memorial service for the six people killed during a mass shooting at a religious service in Hamburg this month

title: Snowfall, heavy rain in Afghanistan kill at least 3
description: An Afghan government spokesman says snowfall and heavy rain have killed at least three people, including a child

title: Taliban want control of more Afghan diplomatic missions
description: A spokesman for the Taliban administration says it is trying to take charge of more Afghan embassies and consulates abroad

title: Ukraine says battle for Bakhmut is 'stabilizing'
description: The top commander of Ukraine’s military said Saturday that his forces are pushing back against Russian troops in the long and grinding battle for the town of Bakhmut

title: German bishop resigns, cites responsibility in abuse scandal
description: Pope Francis on Saturday accepted a resignation request from a German bishop who asked to step down because of his mistakes in handling sexual abuse cases

title: Yemen rebels restrict humanitarian flights arriving in Sanaa
description: The Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen say they are imposing severe restrictions on U.N. and other humanitarian flights arriving in the capital, Sanaa

title: Man attacks 3 people with hand grenade, knife in Berlin
description: German police say they have arrested a 61-year-old man after three people were wounded in a hand grenade and knife attack in Berlin

title: Iran-backed fighters on alert in east Syria after US strikes
description: Syrian opposition activists say Iran-backed fighters are on alert in eastern Syria, a day after U.S. forces launched retaliatory airstrikes on sites in the war-torn country

title: Pope expands sex abuse law, reaffirms adults can be victims
description: Pope Francis has updated a 2019 church law aimed at holding Catholic hierarchs accountable for covering up cases of sex abuse

title: Spiking violence strains sectarian ties in Iraqi province
description: The Iraqi province of Diyala has seen a spike in bloody attacks over the past month that killed at least 19 civilians, including women and children

title: Bolsonaro’s return poses risks for the former president — and Brazil
description: The deeply divided country braces for the homecoming of its most polarizing figure.

title: Berlin vote could turbocharge German capital's climate plans
description: Berlin voters on a proposal Sunday that would force the German capital to drastically ramp up its climate goals

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv frustrated as U.N. report says both sides violated human rights
description: The United Nations says Russia carried out the majority of violations, including arbitrary detention, sexual violence and brutal treatment of prisoners of war.

title: How to flee house arrest in Russia: Escapees tell their secrets
description: Keep the ankle bracelet on. Leave late on Friday when police response times are slow. Wear a disguise. Switch cars often. And don't take a suitcase through muddy fields.
